intro: Allium ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved garlic, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It features grass-like leaves and produces small, spherical flower clusters that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has a bulbous base similar to other members of the Allium genus. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens. Allium ellipticum is relatively low maintenance and thrives in well-drained soils.
